page.title: 13LEYTON FIRE STATION E.10.
page.content: LEYTON FIRE STATION is on the bend of Church road just before Oliver Rd.It only has one Fire Engine.The station was built at the start of the First World War in 1914. In April 1985 there were 100 emergency calls made to Leyton Fire Brigade.Only 50 calls were actual fires and 25 were special visits e.g. to get cats down from trees ,rescue people trapped in lifts etc.The other 25 were either false calls or goodwill calls. A goodwill call is when the caller thinks they are doing the right thing but when the fire brigade arrives they find that it is only a bonfire etc. In Leyton fire station they have a teleprinter which tells them exactly where the emergency call was made.This helps them trace the "false callers"and tell them not to do it again or fine them.
